decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - 1. The change of use from a shop (A1) to a betting shop (A2) is unacceptable in principle as it would result in the loss of a retail unit on a primary frontage, thus harming the character, vitality and viability of the town centre contrary to adopted Unitary Development Plan Policy S.1.1 (Main shopping areas), S.1.2 (Non-retail uses in primary frontages) and IMP 2.2 (Regeneration of Hounslow Town Centre), London Plan 2011 Policy 2.5 (Town Centres), Policy 4.7 (Retail and Town Centre Development) and 4.8 (Supporting a successful and diverse retail sector).

2. The change of use from a shop (A1) to a betting shop (A2) is unacceptable in principle as it would result in an excessive concentration of betting shops in the Hounslow Town Centre thus harming the retail function of the area contrary to Unitary Development Plan Policy S.1.2 (Non-retail uses in primary frontages), and draft London Plan 2011 Draft Town Centres Supplementary Planning Guidance Policy 2.2 (Betting Shops).
description: Change of use of ground floor from use as a shop (A1) to a licensed betting shop (A2).
